contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox officeholder | honorific-prefix = | name = Gabriel Loubier | honorific-suffix = | image = Gabriel Loubier.jpg | caption = Loubier in 1969 | office = Member of the [[National Assembly of Quebec]] for [[Bellechasse (provincial electoral district)|Bellechasse]] | predecessor = [[Gustave Plante]] | successor = [[Pierre Mercier (politician)|Pierre Mercier]] | term_start = 1962 | term_end = 1973 | office2 = [[List of leaders of the Official Opposition of Quebec|Leader of the Official Opposition of Quebec]] | predecessor2 = [[Jean-Jacques Bertrand]] | successor2 = [[Jacques-Yvan Morin]] | term_start2 = 1971 | term_end2 = 1973 | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1932|9|27}} | birth_place = Black Lake, Quebec | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = | spouse = | party = [[Union Nationale (Quebec)|Union Nationale]] | relations = | children = | residence = | alma_mater = | occupation = | profession = | religion = }} '''Gabriel Loubier''' (born September 27, 1932) was a politician in [[Quebec]], [[Canada]]. He served as leader of the ''[[Union Nationale (Quebec)|Union Nationale]]'' party from 1971 to 1974, and as [[Leader of the Official Opposition (Quebec)|Leader of the Opposition]] in the [[National Assembly of Quebec]] from 1971 to 1973. Born in [[Thetford Mines|Black Lake, Quebec]], Loubier was first elected in [[Bellechasse (provincial electoral district)|Bellechasse]] in 1962 and became UN leader in July 1971, replacing former [[Premier of Quebec|Premier]] [[Jean-Jacques Bertrand]] as party leader and leader of the Opposition. From October 25, 1971, to January 14, 1973, the ''Union Nationale'' temporarily changed its name to ''[[Unité Québec]]''. In the [[Quebec general election, 1973|1973 election]], the ''Union Nationale'' was wiped off the electoral map, winning no seats, and Loubier ceased to be leader of the Opposition. He resigned as UN party leader in March 1974. == References == * {{QuebecMNAbio|loubier-gabriel-4255}} {{s-start}} {{s-ppo}} {{succession box | title=Leader of the [[Union Nationale (Quebec)|Union Nationale]]| before=[[Jean-Jacques Bertrand]]| after=[[Maurice Bellemare]]| years=1971–1974}} {{s-end}} {{Authority control|VIAF=43552134}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Loubier, Gabriel | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Canadian politician | DATE OF BIRTH = September 27, 1932 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Loubier, Gabriel}} [[Category:1932 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Lawyers in Quebec]] [[Category:Union Nationale (Quebec) MNAs]] [[Category:Quebec political party leaders]] {{Union-Nationale-Quebec-MNA-stub}}
